intro: Kraenzlinella otopetalum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet to purple flowers. It often grows in disturbed areas and can become invasive in certain environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural research.
